texts.en: Moses is a farmer living in Eldoret, where he has been farming for 7 years. He is married and has 2 children, both of whom are of school-going age. On his farm he produces and sells milk, vegetables, and maize, which he enjoys very much, but he experiences a challenge in a lack of adequate finances for carrying out his farming activities. Moses chose Juhudi Kilimo in order to access asset financing. During the training he learned a lot about group work and unity being key for growth in business. With his loan, Moses will buy animal feed for his cattle.This will cause his income to increase due to increased production.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other raw materials

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia has successfully built her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She has attained a good number of customers. Currently, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 through Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is currently in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of providing good education to her three children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 30 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Samina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Samina has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and seat covers for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Samina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and seat covers for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, coal, and  pig's feet for her business,

loans.name: Mahduma

texts.en:
Mahduma has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time, she has become famous for providing good quality milk and has retained many regular customers. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

In order to inflate her sales she applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Arlene May

texts.en:
Arlene May is a married woman with two children.  She manages a manufacturing business.  She has been doing this for more than two years and earns enough to supplement her husband's income. 

Arlene May used her previous loan from GDMPC to buy more clay to mold and sell, but she needs to have more stock. She requests a new loan to buy additional clay pots to resell. 

Arlene May desires to improve her business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional clay pots to resell.

loans.name: Khei

texts.en: Khei is in his late 40s and  is a resident of Siem Reap province. He earns a living by growing rice on one hectare of farmland.  He also has a business selling sweets. This has been his business for more than 20 years. Khei, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), seeks an education loan in order to pay the tuition fee for his son. He hopes that his son can pursue a bachelor's degree in Information Technology and get a good job.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for his son's education.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 27-year-old married man with three school-aged children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is a farmer and has a side produce business to earn additional income.  He started this business in order to improve his standard of living and to have a stable income.  However, he is challenged by unexpected weather changes that affect his productivity.  He hopes to educate his children through the university level.

Denis is asking for a loan to pay laborers to weed his fields.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed his fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a package of clean cooking gas so that he can reduce on the cost of fuel in the house

loans.name: Thanh An Group

texts.en:
Tuoi is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter. All of the members of her family are farmers with monthly income of approximately 3,500,000 Dong (VND). Cultivating rice, vegetables, and cereal, and breeding chickens, pigs, fish, cattle are their agricultural activities.

In the past, they couldn't afford to pay for their daughter's tuition, that's why she had to quit her education since high school. Currently, they are working laboriously not only to cover living expenses but also in hopes of providing opportunities for their daughter to go to vocational school.

Mrs. Tuoi shares that she's facing difficulties such as lack of access to capital, severe weather in winter, and cattle and poultry diseases. She will use the loan to buy piglets, vaccines, and food for the pigs.

Tuoi is the team leader of Thanh An Group, which consists of 17 Thai ethnic minority women. In the picture, she stands on the first row at the first from right.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vaccines and food for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a clean cooking package so that he can avert dangers of traditional fuels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue an associate degree majoring in Midwifery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clean cooking energy from LPG in order to mitigate cooking costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a package of efficient energy so that she can safe on household energy

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio tiene 50 años, tiene una hija que está en Argentina y tiene 23 años.  El señor anteriormente tenía un autoservice, y con los años y con el dinero que junto se mudó a la ciudad de Luque trabajando en la venta de helados de forma ambulante. Actualmente cuenta con una fábrica de helados.
En el futuro le gustaría montar una Heladería grande, ya que en la zona hay una gran demanda por la temporada de calor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para la producción de helados y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Antonio is 50 years old and has a 23-year-old daughter who lives in Argentina.  Antonio previously had a garage and, with after some time and having saved some money, he moved to the city of Luque and started selling ice creams as a street vendor.  He currently has an ice cream factory.

In the future Antonio would like to open a big ice cream store as there is a lot of demand in the local area during the hot season.

Antonio is applying for this loan in order to invest in supplies to make ice cream and to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make ice cream.

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rumilda tiene 48 años esta casada hace mas de 29 años, tiene tres hijas. Es comerciante hace más de 8 años, tiene una Despensa y Carnicería en su casa, en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, todos los días.
Son una familia muy trabajadora, todos se ayudan mutuamente, y la Sra. Rumilda atiende su negocio ya que su marido trabaja en otra empresa.
También dice que esta muy orgullosa de su familia y que su mayor deseo es que todos sus hijas estudien y sean profesionales para que puedan tener un futuro aun mejor.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rumilda is 48 years old and has been married for 29 years.  She has three daughters.  Rumilda has had a grocery store and butcher shop in her home for eight years.  She works there every day from very early in the morning.

Rumilda's family is very hard working and everybody helps each other out.  Rumilda tends to her business while her husband goes out to work for another business.

Rumilda says that she is very proud of her family and that he biggest wish is for all of her children to study at university so that they may have an even better future.

Rumilda is applying for this loan to invest in buying beverages with which to stock up her business and to continue offering a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks to stock up her store.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид продавец на рынке. Он занимается торговлей овощей. Ему 48 лет. У него жена и двое детей, с которыми он живет в районе Носири Хисрав. Дочери Абдурашида 17 лет, а сыну 14 лет. Они оба учатся в школе. Абдурашид занимается торговлей около 5 лет. Ей помогает жена - спутница жизни. Одновременно Абдурашид еще и предоставляет услуги такси. Он работает на двух работах, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Абдурашид просит кредит для торговой деятельности. На сумму кредита он собирается купить партию овощей для перепродажи.
texts.en:
Abdurashid is a salesman at the market. He works with selling vegetables. He is 48 years old. He has a wife and two children, who he lives together with in the region of Nosiri Khusrav. Abdurashid's daughter is 17 years old, and his son is 14 years old. They both go to school. 

Abdurashid has worked with sales for around 5 years. His wife - his life companion - helps him. At the same time, Abdurashid also provides a taxi service. He works two jobs in order to provide for his family. Abdurashid requests a loan for his sales business. For the loan amount, he intends to purchase a batch of vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for selling

loans.name: Dana Group

texts.en:
Jinan is the featured borrower of Dana group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to cover their needs and satisfy their desires. Jinan and the other group members decided to put their hands together to acquire this loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends who trust each other. Jinan is a 41-year-old married mother of three children, who has been working as a makeup artist from her house for thirteen years. She is very talented in her field and well known in her region.

Jinan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released makeup items, especially for the coming Christmas and winter season, and to invest part of the loan into buying necessary winter needs for her family. This is Jinan's fifth loan cycle through Kiva partner Al Majmoua, her previous loans helped her a lot by increasing her business tools and items. She works hard so that, in the future, she can open her own separate beauty salon outside of her house and provide her customers with necessary privacy. She is the first lady standing on the left. As for the other group members, Dolly is in the center, and Rima is on the right.

loans.use: To buy newly released makeup items, especially for the coming Christmas and winter season, and to invest part of the loan into buying necessary winter needs for her family.

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
Hripsime is from Margahovit village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law, and little grandchildren. The family owns a farm. It includes livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, and chickens as well as arable land where they cultivate potatoes, cabbage, and grass for feeding the livestock. 

Hripsime's sons help their parents to sell the gathered harvest in local open markets.

Realizing that income from agriculture is very important for sustaining this big family's living, Hripsime has decided to apply for this loan. She plans to purchase three cows and enlarge the livestock.

As this is Hripsime's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Hripsime and her family will be very grateful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de San Luis, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su relieve accidentado y hermosos paisajes verdes, ubicado a 02 horas del distrito, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto tiene sembrado aproximadamente 02 ha de la variedad catimor, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 66 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of San Luis, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás, where the people work in agriculture and commerce. It is a community known for its rugged terrain and beautiful green landscapes, located some two hours from the district, it belongs to the province of Cultervo located in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Perú.

He works in agriculture, growing coffee and has planted approximately two hectares of a variety of Catimor coffee plants. He has been engaged in this activity for ten years and so he has a lot of experience. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles so he can maintain his crops by buying fertilizer and to provide payment for workers so that he can have a favorable harvest to offer at a good price to his customers, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of coffee and to pay laborers

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор трудолюбивая женщина. Она мать 6 детей. Ее муж Азизулло очень добрый человек. Гулбахор более 10 лет занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Гулбахор торгует на местном рынке. Она очень любит детей и поэтому всегда хочет, чтобы все дети одевались красиво. Она старается предоставить товары на высшем уровне своим клиентам. Гулбахор хочет увеличить доход и от полученного дохода, помочь нуждающимся детям канун праздника Нового года. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки детской одежды для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a hardworking woman. She is the mother of six children. Her husband Azizullo is a very kind person. For more than ten years, Gulbahor is engaged in buying and selling children's clothing. Gulbahor trades at the local market. She loves her children very much and therefore all the children are nicely dressed. She tries to offer goods of the highest quality to her customers.

Gulbahor wants to increase her income and from the earned income to help children in need for the New Year holiday. Gulbahor is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase children's clothing for expanding her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase new children's clothing in order to increase inventory

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores  de edad y dos de  13 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es mecánico electricista
Doña Rosa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto poder solventar sus gastos y los del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, ella trabaja tres a cuatros  días a la semana en sus recorridos ya que su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha  las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, lleva seis meses en este negocio el cual le da sus propios ingresos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y zapatos ya que tiene varios pedidos para este mes. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella se gana lo suyo. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Abdón Calderón in the city of Manta. This city is well-known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. It is also a city that is unequaled in its beauty and has many tourists attractions.

Sra. Rosa lives in this place. She is 43 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. Two of her children are grown and the other two (ages 13 and 6) are in school. Her husband is an electrician.

In order to have an income by which to pay her expenses and those of her household, Rosa sells clothing and shoes. She works three to four days a week by going door-to-door. Rosa takes advantage of the morning hours since it is easier to make her trips around this time. She has been in this business for six months and it has given her an income of her own.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, children's clothing, and shoes since she has several orders this month. Rosa has been with the Communal Bank for more than four years and she enjoys being a member because of what she has gained. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, children's clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Shawanda

texts.en:
In her hometown of Baton Rouge, 35-year-old Shawanda owns and operates Platinum Events 225, an event planning organization.

To help her friends and family, Shawanda put her talent of event planning to work for many years.  It wasn’t until July 2013 when she decided to truly get to work and made the decision to utilize her talents and turn her passion into a business.

As a start-up, Shawanda limits her business to weddings, parties, reunions, funerals, and other traditional family get-togethers, but was in need of funds to market her new business and complete projects. 

Shawanda is a returning client of Accion Texas Inc. and is aware of the benefits gained from applying for a business loan from the nonprofit organization. She says without the loan, she would not have the funds needed to accept and complete current projects she was offered, or advertise to reach a larger market or gain new clients.

Currently, Shawanda works alone but plans to hire one full-time and two part-time employees in the future. View all that Shawanda has to offer on her website http://www.platinumevents.org/ or Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/PlatinumEventsLLC.

loans.use: to market her new business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 41-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), is efficiently running a business selling ice cream to the people of their community. They have been doing it for many years. Both are working together happily in order to meet the needs of their five children. For the improvement of her business, Robina contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. It will help her to purchase stock of sugar and cream along with packs of milk. She hopes to get an increase in their earnings through their larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar and cream along with packs of milk.

loans.name: Nodari

texts.en:
Nodari is a 68-year-old man, from the village of Gumbra. He lives with his wife and both get a pension from the local government. 

For more than ten years, Nodari has been involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he takes care of a bull and a plot of agricultural land, where he harvests maize and sells it to the local market. 

Nodari wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of GEL 1,000 will be a great support to this hard-working man, enabling him to purchase a milk cow, produce cheese and yogurt, and sell it locally. This will be an additional source of income for this hard-working man, improving his living conditions. 

Nodari and his wife rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Nilsa Estella

texts.es:
Nilsa es una campesina de 30 años de edad, que desde muy joven aprendió todas las tareas agrícolas, pues su familia vivía de esta labor. Actualmente posee cultivos de papa criolla y arveja, las cosechas que recolecta las vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside con su esposo y sus dos hijos, de esta forma genera los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía del hogar.
La cliente manifiesta que ha pasado por algunas dificultades, pues luego de recoger la última cosecha de papa, no ha tenido capital para comprar las semillas, por ello se motiva a solicitar el crédito como un apoyo para continuar con su labor, el dinero lo invertirá en semillas, abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y otros insumos necesarios para sus cultivos, esto le permitirá reactivar sus cultivos y así tener la capacidad para solventar los gastos familiares básicos.
Nilsa manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es adquirir su propia finca en la que pueda cultivar más variedad de productos y así garantizar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar y brindarles educación para que se conviertan en personas íntegras y puedan forjarse un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Nilsa is a 30 year-old farmer. She learned all the agricultural tasks from a very young age, and her family lived off of this type of work. Currently she has seed potato and pea plants, and she sells the harvests she collects in the market of the town where she resides with her husband and children. Through this, she generates sufficient income to support the household costs. 

Nilsa expresses that she has experienced some difficulties. After collecting the last potato harvest, she has not had the capital to purchase seeds. She is seeking this loan to support and continue her work, and she will invest this money in seeds, manure, irrigation, fertilizer, and other necessary supplies for her plants. This will allow her to revive her crops, and she will be able to cover the basic costs for her family. Nilsa says that her greatest wish is to purchase her own farm, where she can grow a wider variety of products. Through this, she can guarantee an improved well-being for her children and give them the necessary education for them to become people of integrity and forge a successful future.

loans.use: to invest in seeds, manure, irrigation, fertilizer, and other necessary supplies for her plants.

loans.name: Seu

texts.en:
Seu is a resident living in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She is 63 years of age, widowed and has three children. 

She is currently in the business of making and selling fermented fish in a local market, in addition to her farming work.  She has been a fish vendor for more than 20 years. From this selling business, she is able to earn USD 5.00 per day to use for meals and to cover other costs of living, but it seems not enough for their needs due to the increase in the demand of their living needs day to day.

Seu’s house is recently under construction, and it needs more wood to have it finished. Due to the shortage of money, Seu would like to borrow a loan in the amount of USD 1,300 to buy wood for her home construction. With the help of the loan, Seu will be able to provide a suitable shelter for her children and make their lives more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy wood for her home construction.

loans.name: Sonny Boy

texts.en:
Sonny Boy  is a  41-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Eily and they have children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. He works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Sonny Boy sells different medicines. It is cheaper to buy from him because he does not need to rent a stall. These medicines are mostly for headaches, toothaches and other minor ailments.  He earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he requests a loan of 8,000 PHP. He will use the loan to increase his stock of medicine.

Sonny Boy dreams that his business will grow and hopes to give his family a good life. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week  to share stories of his work.  He also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of medicine needed in his business.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 44 years old and married with six children, two of the children work in various jobs in Phnom Penh. 

Sokhom began working in the agricultural business at an early age to help her parents. This income is not enough to take care of her family, so she also sells fish to increase her income. She has worked in these two businesses for years.

To further develop her farming business, she recently decided to buy rice seeds to sow in her fields. Her husband and children help with the farm work. Growing rice will enable Sokhom to meet her daily living needs and repay the loan to the institution. 

She is very happy and thankful for the loan support.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to sow in her fields.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a thirty-two-year-old female living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells drugs along the market street in Kigumba town council, plus earns a government salary as her side income.

Elizabeth started the business in 2007 so as to cater to her family. Inadequate capital is her major challenge, whereas her vision is to expand her business into a big pharmacy in Masindi town. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Thorn, 39, is a resident of Siem Reap Province where she does rice cropping on two hectares of farmland. Besides this agribusiness, she earns additional income via her husband who works at a construction site. The 14 years of involvement in her current business has enabled her to generate almost $9 US per day. Thorn is a first-time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva‘s partner). For this cycle, she wants to focus on her daughter’s education. Hence, she is seeking an education loan to cover her daughter's tuition fee for an Accounting major. She hopes that her daughter can get a decent job as an accountant after she graduates.

loans.use: To cover her daughter's tuition fee for an Accounting major.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Все дети -школьники.  У Гульмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная коровы, 1 лошадь, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях предотвращения падежа скота Гульмира планирует провести ряд ветеринарных мероприятий. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Гульмира -домохозяйка, в свободное от домашних дел время она шьет. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 35 years old, married, and together with her spouse is raising four children. All the children are in school. Gulmira has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Gulmira raises livestock, having begun 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 6,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Gulmira currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, one horse, and 20 sheep. Monthly income consists of 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to prevent loss of livestock, Gulmira plans to conduct a series of veterinary measures. Hay and feed for the livestock have been procured. With the aim of further developing her homestead, Gulmira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase sheep for expanding her count of livestock.

Gulmira is a homemaker; in her free time from house work, she sews. Gulmira plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru:
Шерали  молодой  мужчина, он женат и имеет четверых детей.  Он занимается разведением коров и быка. Его семья поддерживает его  в бизнесе, его старший  сын  вместо пастуха выводит скот на пастбище, Шерали купил для сына коня , что бы тот мог легко пасти их скот.  Каждый раз после покупки  и откорма скота он сдает скот мясникам,  что бы заработать больше денег.
 В настоящее время Шерали необходимо накупить много сена и различного корма, так как  он должен запастись кормом на зиму,  запас корма который он делал раньше закончился, поэтому что бы его скот не истощал он обратился в Арванд, для финансовой поддержки, он очень надеется на помощь от КИВА.
texts.en:
Sherali is a young man. He is married and has four children. He is engaged in breeding cows and bulls. His family supports him in the business. Instead of a shepherd, his elder son takes the cattle to pasture. Sherali bought his son a horse, in order to be able to easily bring their cattle to pasture. Every time after purchase and fattening of cattle, he delivers the cattle to the butchers in order to earn more money.

At the present moment, Sherali needs to buy more hay and various feeds, since he must stock up feed for the winter. The supply of food that he made previously has finished. Therefore in order that his cattle will not deplete, he appealed to Arvand, for financial support. He very much hopes for the help from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Puthea

texts.en:
Puthea is a 52-year-old married woman with one child. She resides in Phnom Penh, Capital City of Cambodia.

The main source of her income is from her husband's occupation as a government officer. She earns additional income by running a small stall to sell coffee. This stall is in front of her neighbor's house that sells construction items. 

This is not Puthea's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She successfully repaid her previous loan.  Puthea used her prior loan to improve her living conditions and to keep her child in school. Besides her own family, Puthea supports the education costs for her younger brother. Therefore, she decided to take a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her brother to pursue a masters degree at a local university. She hopes that her younger brother will get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to support her brother's pursuit of a masters degree at a local university.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea, a 33-year-old mother of three children, two in school and one yet too young to attend, resides in Kampong Cham province. For the sake of her entire household, she buys the rice and cassava crops of others to resell, a business she has had for 13 years. 

This will be Kea's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) which she will use to buy others’ cassava yields to resell. She hopes that she can gain more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy others’ cassava yield for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Дети маленькие учатся в школе. У Жамилы - среднее образование, она домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей, ведет домашнее хозяйство. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамила занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамила обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку стиральной машины для своей большой семьи.
texts.en:
Jamila is 37 years old, married, and is raising four children with her husband. The young children go to school. Jamila has a high school education. She is a homemaker, engaged in raising the children and running the domestic household. As a main source of income for her family, Jamila raises livestock, having begun 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Jamila today has on her homestead: two dairy cows, two horses, and ten sheep. Monthly income consists of 7,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Jamila turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy sheep for expanding her livestock count.

Jamila plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to purchase a washing machine for her large family.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida, age 54, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult.

For that, his wife Sajida, as a member of a two-person lending group, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. 

Sajida is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is 41 years old and a widowed mother of four children, residing in the Prasat Balang district in Kompong Thom province. She earns a living via rice farming and working for others for a fee.  Nowadays, she can earn up to USD 6 per day. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years. 

This is the first loan for Khim with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she is seeking an education loan in order to cover the tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue his study, majoring in marketing. She hopes that he can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Hadyatullo

texts.ru:
Хадьятулло 30 лет. Он живет на районе Дж.Руми. Хадьятулло женат на Мохичиен. У них двое маленьких дочерей. Их дочери 2011 и 2013 года рождения. 
  В Таджикистане чистый воздух и несравненная природа. Пользуясь благоприятным климатом, Хадьятулло решил заниматься животноводством. Около 6 лет он держит у себя дома скотов для семейных нужд. Сейчас он решил свой опыт вложит в бизнес и начать деятельность скотоводства. На данный момент у него только 2 коровы, но для такого бизнеса ему не достаточно. Поэтому он просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота и начать бизнес. Хадьятулло уверенный себе мужчина, он уверен, что его ждет удача в его деятельности.
texts.en:
Hadyatullo is 30 years old and lives in the J.Rumy region. Hadyatullo is married to Mohichien, and they have two small children. Their daughters were born in 2011 and 2013. In Tajikistan, there is clean air and incomparable nature. Taking advantage of the favorable climate, Hadyatullo decided to start working with livestock. He has been keeping livestock at his home for around 6 years, to cover the family's needs. 

Now Hadyatullo has decided to put his experience into business and start breeding cattle. Currently he only has 2 cows, and for this type of business it is not sufficient. Due to this, Hadyatullo decided to purchase some heads of cattle and start the new business. Hadyatullo is a confident man, and he is sure that luck awaits his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to start a new business

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Helena, who is in her early 40s, is married and has two boys and two girls. All of them are enrolled in school. Helena has been running a business, selling clothes and shoes door-to-door, for three years now. She works from 7:00am to 5:00pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This is the second loan request by Helena to Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase her business stock of clothes and shoes. She paid back her loan successfully, and with her profit, Helena covered home and school expenses, together with ploughing back [profit] into her business. She will use this loan to buy new business stock to sell up-country. Helena dreams of owning business premises, so as to avoid door-to-door movement.

Helena will share this loan with her loan group, "Peacock." The group totals three members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business stock to sell up-country.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams and charcoal.

loans.name: Parana Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe PARANA ont en moyenne  45 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KIMPARANA dans le cercle  de SAN dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires et des articles divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe PARANA sont à leur 7 eme   prêt solidaire. KOTIMI 1ere femme à   droite  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 litres d’huile, un sac de 100kgs de riz, deux kg de poissons fumés, vingt kg d’oignons, 10 paquets de cube Maggi et des légumes et des piments. Elle s’approvisionne à KIMPARANA. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Parana" group are on average 45 years old with six children and all live in traditional extended households in Kimparana, in the San circle in the fourth administrative of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling food products and various items..
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Parana group are on their seventh solidarity (group) loan. Kotimi, the woman all the way on the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 20 litres of oil, one 100-kg bag of rice, 2 kg of smoked fish, 20 kg of onions, 10 packets of Maggi cubes, vegetables, and chili peppers. She gets her supplies in Kimparana and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Genoveva Betty

texts.es:
La socia Genoveva Genoveva Betty se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros como parabrisas,faros y llantas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar parabrisas,siliconas y brisas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Genoveva Betty continues to operate a business that sells automobile parts such as windshields, headlights, and tires. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Genoveva has worked several years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her auto parts business.

Genoveva is requesting a loan in order to buy windshields, silicone, and other merchandise. She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy windshields, silicone, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI ont en moyenne  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TOMINIAN chef lieu du cercle dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur 8 eme   prêt solidaire. SANIHAN 1ere femme assise de  la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 litres d’huile, des poivrons, vingt kg de poissons fumés, vingt kg d’oignons et dix cartons de cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne à TOMINIAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Sinignessigui" group are on average 39 years old with five children and all live in traditional extended households in Tominian, the main local city in the fourth administrative of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling food products.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Sinignessigui group are on their eighth solidarity (group) loan. Sanihan, the woman sitting all the way on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 10 litres of oil, bell peppers, 20 kg of smoked fish, 20 kg of onions, and 10 boxes of Maggi cubes. She gets her supplies in Tominian and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Chut's Group

texts.en:
Chut was born in 1956 and she is now living with her family in Bac Ninh. She has three children, and her oldest child is married. Her husband is a miller.

To make a living, Chut sells food and electronic goods. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for nine years. Her family’s total earnings are about 14,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to sell food. Her dream is to expand her business and buy more equipment for her house. This loan is one of the steps to help her to achieve this dream. 

Chut is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She also has a passion for her job. She said that this job helps her earn more money to pay for living. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 10,528,000 VND and repaid on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 11,872,000 VND to sell food. She always wants to expand her business, repair her house and have a better life in future. 

Other members who are part of Chut's group include the following:
Hoa is 50 years old. She has three children. She sells motorcycle parts to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to sell motorcycle parts.
Ly is 62 years old. She has four children. She sells clothing to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to sell clothing.
Lien is 30 years old. She has two children. She sells drink to earn a living. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to sell drinks.
Vinh is 51 years old. She has two children. She sells jewellery to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to sell jewellery.
Ngan is 49 years old. She has three children. She sells food to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to sell food.
Hanh is 40 years old. She has four children. She sells food to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to sell food.

loans.use: to sell food.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA ont en moyenne  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KIMPARANA dans Le cercle  de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers tels les produits artisanaux.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA sont à leur 8 eme   prêt solidaire. AWA 2 eme femme de  la gauche vers la droite  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter cinquante jarres, soixante gargoulettes. Elle s’approvisionne à MOPTI. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Siguidia" group are on average 38 years old with four children and all live in traditional extended households in Kimparana, in the San circle in the fourth administrative of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling various items such as artisanal products..
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Siguidia group are on their eighth solidarity (group) loan. Awa, the woman second from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 50 earthenware urns, and 60 water jugs. She gets her supplies in Mopti and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy artisanal products.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin is 40 years old. She has two children who are workers. Her husband is a driver. She raises poultry to earn a living.  Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND and Chin earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 16 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to build her farm and invest in her business. 

Her dreams are to raise chickens and other animals without diseases, buy five more pigs, and build her house and farm clean and wide. This loan is one of the steps that helps her achieve this dream. She can buy more food to feed her chickens. Then she can save the profit for her dreams. Chin is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid her loan on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy chickens to raise and to repair her chicken coop. 

Other members who are part of Chin's group include the following: 

Quy is 47 years old. She has two children. She is a food seller. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy ingredients for her food stall.

An is 34 years old. She has two children. She sells tofu. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to sell breakfast in the market.

Lang is 28 years old. She has two children. She sells medicine. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more medicine for her small pharmacy.

Loc is 52 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and to repair her chicken coop.

loans.name: Finte Allabo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FINTE-ALLABO ont en moyenne  44 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TENE dans le cercle  de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers : boissons, produits alimentaires, etc..
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FINTE-ALLABO sont à leur 15 eme   prêt solidaire. AISSATA 2eme femme de  la droite vers la gauche   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 casiers  de boissons non alcoolisées : Coca-Cola, Fanta orange, ananas et  des sachets d’eaux. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 85 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Finte-Allabo" group are on average 45 years old with five children and all live in traditional extended households in Tene, in the San circle in the fourth administrative of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling various items: drinks, food products, etc.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Finte-Allabo group are on their 15th solidarity (group) loan. Aissata, the woman second from right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 100 cases of non-alcoholic drinks: Coca-Cola, Fanta orange, pineapples, and packets of water. She gets her supplies in San and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 85,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Jehová es mi pastor está conformado por 12 integrantes once mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 22 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de actividades con sus familias, le preparan platos típicos como nacatamales. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron  cursar 
una carrera y se vieron  en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracia a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora de la asociación comunal es Audeli  y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, queso, tiste. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal association Jehová es mi pastor (Jehovah Is My Shepherd) is made up of 12 members (11 women and 1 man) who are parents with 22 children under their responsibility. They are hardworking and responsible, and they have a strong desire for self-improvement. In their free time they enjoy family activities and they make typical dishes such as nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, they weren’t able to get a college degree and had to start working at a young age.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator of the communal association is Audeli; she makes her living with a pulpería [grocery store], a small store that sells consumable products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, cheese, and tiste [a Nicaraguan drink]. She works 12 hours per day in her business offering her products; she runs the business out of her house. The objective of the loan is as a working capital loan to stock her store with consumable products so that she might have more income in the not-too-far future.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock her store with consumable products such as  rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, cheese, and tiste [a Nicaraguan drink].

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Lafiala de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les condiments, de fruits légumes, du charbon de bois, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Maïmouna assise en deuxième position à gauche compte utilise son prêt pour acheter au fur et a mesure les légumes de toutes sortes. Elle se procure de ces légumes au grand marché  les jeudis, jour de foire. et le lundi. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 56.000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Maïmouna  compte réaliser  64.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement du prêt, elle utilise une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the Lafiala district of the city of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, their children and some relatives. They average 37 years of age and four children each. They sell various goods such as condiments, fruits and vegetables, charcoal, etc.

To expand their activities, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is their 2nd group loan cycle. 

Maïmouna is the member sitting 2nd from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy various vegetables as the need may arise. She buys her stock at the main market on Thursdays (fair day) and Mondays. She retails her merchandise for cash to a diverse clientele, at the market and from her home.

The other group members expect to earn an average profit of 56,000FCFA each for this cycle. For her part, Maïmouna expects to earn 64,000FCFA.

In addition to repaying her loan, she will use part of her revenue to cover personal expenses and to bolster her working capital.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia del grupo de crédito 26-71, este en su segundo crédito. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de paisajes inigualables, su centro histórico conserva su arquitectura al igual que su gente conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
Doña María tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y su segundo hijo en la escuela, su esposo labora como auxiliar de enfermería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señora María es una mujer dinámica que se dedica a varias actividades, es masajista y realiza manicures, también tiene una tienda. Todas estas actividades las aprendió trabajando. 
Ella está repitiendo crédito para comprar víveres para su tienda. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of loan group 26-71 and this is her second loan. She lives in the central area of the city of Cuenca, a city that enjoys unmatched landscapes. Its historical center preserves its architecture that same way that its people preserve their culture and traditions.

María is 36 years old and is married. From her marriage she has conceived two children who are thirteen and four years old. Her older son is in high school and her younger son in elementary school. Her husband works as a nurse's aide. They don't have a house of their own so they are renting the place where they live.

María is a dynamic woman who makes a living from various businesses. She is a massage therapist and does manicures. She also has a store. She learned all of these businesses by working. 

She is taking another loan to buy foodstuffs for her store. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Flor Senobia

texts.es:
Flor tiene 37 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras lo realizan en el comercial Rodríguez en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito  para la compra de insumos como los abonos, ureas, fertilizantes. Su sueño es mejorar la economía de la  familia. Los desafíos que se  enfrentan  dificultades económicas. 

Le gusta viajar los fines de semana con la familia.
texts.en:
Flor is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and their two children in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province. She is a member of the '30 de Noviembre' loan group that is located in the Mina de Piedra precinct in the Ventanas canton, where residents make a living from agricultural work and livestock.

Flor makes a living from agriculture, growing corn. She will make the purchases in the Rodríguez shopping area in Ventanas. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies like manure, urea and fertilizers. 

Her dream is to improve her family's finances. The challenges she faces are financial difficulties. On the weekends she likes to travel with her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, and fertilizers

loans.name: Danny Alexander

texts.es:
Danny tiene 36 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en ventanas  Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agropecuarias.
Danny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra  de  abonos organicos, como urea. Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y tener una buena producción. Los desafíos que se enfrenta son las plagas y las enfermedades falta de capital para trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y viajar.
texts.en:
Danny is 36 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and his two children in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the communal bank “Bruniquildi”, which is located in the rural community of Calabi, in the canton of Ventanas. Its members make a living from agricultural work and working with livestock.

Danny sows rice. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase organic fertilizers, such as urea. He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to have good health so he can continue working and have good output. The challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and the lack of working capital. In his free time he likes to play sport and travel.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, such as urea

loans.name: Joffre Jose

texts.es:
Joffre tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil Union libre, vive con su esposa y su madre en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 
Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Joffre se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de arroz, maíz y para la compra que es necesaria en la agricultura como la semilla y el abono.   Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos que se enfrenta es presencia de mucha lluvia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear en el pueblo con su familia.
texts.en:
Joffre is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and his mother in the Mina de Piedra precinct in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province. He belongs to the '30 de noviembre' loan group located in the Mina de Piedra precinct of the Ventanas canton, where residents make a living from agricultural work and livestock. 

Joffre makes a living from agriculture, growing rice and corn. He is asking for the loan to plant rice and corn, and to buy what he needs for agricultural work, such as seeds and manure. He will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

His dream is to improve his living conditions. The challenge he faces is the presence of a lot of rain. In his free time he likes to explore the town with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters for personal use and resale

loans.name: Víctor Yuri

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre trabajador que ha luchado arduamente para sacar adelante su familia. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar de manera independiente, inició fabricando un implemento para partir panela, producto que vendía de manera ambulante por las calles de su ciudad natal, trabajó durante 17 años y luego, en compañía de su familia, decidió trasladarse para la ciudad donde reside actualmente, ya radicado comenzó a vender el mismo producto y además compra y revende otros artículos; trabaja solo todos los días de 10 am a 6 pm y ya tiene un punto fijo en el que se ubica para realizar su labor; así ha generado los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar durante los últimos 13 años que lleva radicado en este sector.
El crédito lo solicita como un apoyo para comprar materia prima (madera, alambre y otros) y mercancía al por mayor (artesanías), así le dará continuidad a su negocio y podrá aumentar las ventas, ofreciendo mayor variedad de artículos para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
Víctor manifiesta que su mayor propósito es poder continuar velando por el bienestar de su grupo familiar, por ello manifiesta que seguirá trabajando con esmero y dedicación hasta que Dios y su cuerpo se lo permitan, pues quiere brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor's a hardworking man who has strived very hard to get his family ahead.  During his working life he has earned a living working on his own.  He began making a tool to cut sugarcane.  He sold his product for 17 years as a street vendor in his hometown.  Later, he and his family decided to move to the city where he currently lives.  Once settled he started selling the same product in addition to buying and selling other items.

Víctor works alone from 10 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day, and now has a fixed location where he does his job.  He has generated enough income this way to cover his basic household expenses for the 13 years he has been in this area.

He's requesting the loan to help buy wood, wire, and other supplies as well as wholesale handicrafts so he can continue with his business and increase his sales.  He'll offer a greater variety of articles to satisfy his customers' needs.

Víctor says his biggest goal is to be able to continue watching over his family's welfare.  This is why he'll keep on working with care and dedication as long as God and his body allow, because he wants to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg, who lives in Vanadzor town with his parents, wife and little daughter, sells shoes in a small rented store. His father is a teacher with many years of experience at a local school. In business for two years, twice a month Gevorg orders shoes from Yerevan, reselling them in his store in Vanadzor. 

In order to better sustain his family's living, Gevorg would like to expand his enterprise. He is requesting this loan to purchase a new stock of shoes. Gevorg took a previous loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it on time. However, thanks to his recent hard work, he is now able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Gevorg has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра очень добрая женщина. Она замужем. Ее мужа зовут Равшан. Гулчехра и Равшан имеют 2 детей. Их дети совершеннолетние. Гулчехра 20 лет назад начала свой бизнес, так как она нуждалась в деньгах. Гулчехра занимается купле продажей булочек на местном рынке. Она имеет свою точку продажи на местном рынке. Она с бизнесом справляется сама. Гулчехра уже давно мечтает купить мебель для своего дома и улучшить условию проживания. Однако она не имеет достаточно денег. Гулчехра решила увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки булочек. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a very kind woman. She is married. Her husband is named Ravshan. Gulchehra and Ravshan have two children. Their children are adult-aged. 20 years ago, Gulchehra began her own business, since she needed money. Gulchehra buys and sells buns at the local market, where she has her own retail stall. She manages with the business by herself.

Gulchehra for a long time has dreamed of buying furniture for her home and improving living conditions. At the same time, she does not have sufficient money. Gulchehra decided to expand her working capital and in this way to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy buns.

loans.use: to buy rolls for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and has three young children. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fish-vending business for more than seven years. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies of fresh fish, squid and shrimp, and tools such as a weighing scale and styrofoam. She works hard to support her family and to continue to develop a business, for her children. Leonora hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies of fresh seafood and tools, such as a weighing scale and styrofoam.

loans.name: Tajinisa

texts.ru: Тажиниса, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Тажиниса в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву приданного для невест таких как: национальные матрасы, подушки, перина с 2003 года, стартовав с суммы 3,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Тажиниса с удовольствием занимается своей работой-пошивом приданного для невест у себя на дому, бизнес семейный, супруг активно помогает в бизнесе. Готовую продукцию сдают реализаторам и торговцам на местном рынке. Этот бизнес приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тажиниса обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом-на покупку новой электрической швейной машинки и материалов для производства и пошива приданного. На доходы от кредита Тажиниса хочет увеличить товарооборот и намерена улучшить благоустройство семьи.
texts.en:
Tajinisa is married and raising five children together with her husband. In search of income for her family, Tajinisa started a small business of sewing dowry for brides, such as national mattresses, pillows and duvets. She started in 2003, with the amount of 3,000 som (KGS). The business is very good and most importantly, Tajinisa enjoys her work of sewing dowry for brides; from her home, as a family run business, with her husband actively helping with the business. The ready-made products are sold at the local market. This business brings in a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Tajinisa turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase a new, electrical sewing machine and materials for production and sewing of dowry. Tajinisa would like to increase her turnover with this loan, and intends to improve the family well-being from the income.

loans.use: to buy an electrical sewing machine and materials for sewing

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 35-year-old single parent living in Masindi, Uganda. She has owned a school that her late husband left for the past four years. It has not been easy for her because being a widow and sole provider for the family is her challenge. However, she has been a hardworking woman in that she has managed to keep the school going and her enrollment has increased, hence generating increased profits.

Harriet is in need of a loan to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to complete her residential house

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVAR” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Clotilde es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzados, venta de ropa, venta de ganado, venta de comida, venta de condimentos, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Clotilde es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de calzados deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo a quien ayudaba en su negocio, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las atenciones en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bolivar is starting its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Los Andes regional office. The communal bank is made up of eight members, and is directed by a board of directors, of which Clotilde is the president. The businesses of the members are varied and include selling footwear, clothing, livestock, food, seasonings and furniture.

This loan will be used in some small businesses of which Clotilde is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago at the invitation of a promoter that went to see her in her home. Clotilde’s business is making sports shoes. She says that she learned this business from her husband, whom she used to help. Later, she decided to start her own business.

Clotilde is requesting this loan to increase the capital of her business by buying leather, which she will buy from the distributors in the city of El Alto. After she makes the shoes, she will sell them from her sales space. This work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Clotilde replies that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy leather for her sports shoes business.

loans.name: Mujeres Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES MAÑANERAS” iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de condimento, venta de guantes, servicio de centro de llamadas, venta de tucumanas, venta de aguayos y velos, pensión, venta de frazada, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, al principio lo aprendió como un distracción, posteriormente observo que la técnica le ayudaría a generar recursos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las atenciones en salud y la reunión de grupo.
texts.en: The "Mujeres Mananeras" communal association is starting its 7th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de  Los Andes.  The group is made up of twelve members, and is led by an executive board of which Carmen is the president.  The members operate a variety of businesses including:  a neighborhood store, selling clothing, selling food seasoning, selling gloves, providing call center services, selling woolen cloth and veils, operating a guest house, selling blankets, and selling chickens.  The loan will benefit small businesses such as the one run by Carmen, who says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of her sister who is a member.  She now has a business weaving and selling blankets, which is an activity that she learned on her own initiative several years ago.  At first she learned it as a hobby,  but later she saw that it could help her to earn income.  The loan that she is taking now is to increase her capital (by buying wool), which she buys from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then uses to produce the products that she sells in her sales location.  This work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she is married.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes its focus on health and the group meetings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe NIETA ont en moyenne  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à   KARANTELA l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de fruits et légumes.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur 2eme   prêt solidaire. BINTOU  femme assise au milieu sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de bananes et 1 sac de 100kgs d’oranges. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN et les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Nieta" group are on average 39 years old with five children and all live in traditional extended households in Karantela, one of the districts of the city of San in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling fruits and vegetables.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Nieta group are on their second solidarity (group) loan. Bintou, the woman sitting in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of bananas and one 100-kg sack of oranges. She gets her supplies in San and the surrounding towns, and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Jhonny
